greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = gcd(n,binomial(n,floor(n/2))).
comment: For even n, a(n) is an even divisor of n.
link: Hugo Pfoertner, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
maple: swing := n -> n!/iquo(n,2)!^2: seq(igcd(n,swing(n)), n=1..82); # _Peter Luschny_, May 17 2013
mathematica: a[n_] := GCD[n, Binomial[n, Floor[n/2]]]; Array[a, 100] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 03 2019 *)
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Nov 13 2000
ext: Offset changed to 1 by _Peter Luschny_, May 17 2013
